item.title: Project Icon: The UK’s Next Music Star
item.description: Ten of the UK’s most promising unsigned artists head to Manchester to attempt to convince the judges that they have everything it takes to cut through in today’s music industry.

item.title: Great Expectations
item.description: Through a twist of fate, Pip, an orphan who yearns for a greater lot in life, meets the mysterious and eccentric Miss Havisham, who shows him a dark world of possibilities.

item.title: Race Across the World
item.description: Five teams set off from Vancouver on a race across Canada. Without smartphones, internet access or credit cards, they will need plenty of ingenuity to make it to the finish line in Newfoundland.

item.title: Blue Lights
item.description: PSNI probationer Grace promises to help Angela, whose son has fallen in with a notorious gang. But with undercover agents watching, will she be able to keep her word?

item.title: Wild Isles
item.description: David Attenborough celebrates the rich variety of habitats in our wild isles, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe.

item.title: The Cleaner
item.description: Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control: a job in a pub, after he’s promised his new girlfriend he’ll stay off the booze.

item.title: Great British Menu
item.description: The eight regional champions cook their vegan starter courses in a bid to secure the first place on the menu at the banquet. Comedian and actor Kulvinder Ghir is the guest judge.

item.title: Murder in Mayfair
item.description: In 2008, student Martine Vik Magnussen was killed after a night out. The only suspect, the son of a billionaire, fled the UK to Yemen. Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi is determined to speak to him.

item.title: Facelift
item.description: An insight into the lives of Dr Darren McKeown and husband Tom as they navigate a big year running a cosmetic clinic, building a luxurious cosmetic hospital and having their first child.

item.title: The Apprentice
item.description: Lord Sugar’s candidates touch down on the Caribbean island of Antigua to sell and run bespoke tours. Then, back in Blighty, one candidate is sent packing.

item.title: FBoy Island NZ
item.description: Kiera, Coco and Kita are three stunning Kiwi women in search of the guy of their dreams. But can they tell the difference between the genuine 'nice guys' and the Fboys?

item.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
item.description: Ten budding interior designers are challenged to transform luxury apartments in London’s Elephant and Castle. Hosted by Alan Carr.

item.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
item.description: Told from the inside by the police who were there, this is the true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist.

item.title: Phoenix Rise
item.description: It’s the first day of term at Phoenix Rise, and for six new pupils it’s a chance to start again. But is it ever that easy?

item.title: The Cockfields
item.description: Simon's taking girlfriend Donna to meet his family for the first time.

item.title: Beyond Paradise
item.description: A new adventure awaits as DI Humphrey Goodman and Martha leave London for Devon. Humphrey dives into his first case, which involves an unusual prime suspect: a 17th-century witch.

item.title: EastEnders
item.description: Ben finds himself in a tough situation as he tries to impress Phil. Keanu seeks advice from an unlikely source, and Rocky worries about his past.

item.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
item.description: Tom Allen meets Lord Sugar’s new business partner to discuss the most memorable moments of the past 12 weeks. They are joined by special guests.

item.title: Meet Joe Black
item.description: Media tycoon William Parrish has his charmed life and orderly household disrupted by the arrival of an engimatic young man who proceeds to fall in love with Parrish's daughter.

item.title: Anton & Giovanni’s Adventures in Sicily
item.description: The first leg of Anton and Giovanni’s Sicilian road trip begins in the port town of Sciacca. From there, it takes in Greek architecture, octopus fishing and a tango festival.

item.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
item.description: Michael McIntyre hosts as Chris Hoy, Georgia Toffolo, Robert Peston, Snoochie Shy, Bez, Dr Zoe Williams and Joel Dommett try to help the contestants answer their way to a fortune.

item.title: Big Night of Musicals by the National Lottery
item.description: From Hamilton to Wicked, this celebration of musical theatre is packed full of performances from the nation’s best-loved shows. Hosted by Jason Manford.

item.title: Darkest Hour
item.description: As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to negotiate with Hitler or fight for the greater good.

item.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
item.description: A moving and insightful film celebrating the remarkable story of one of football's most talented players, Gareth Bale.

item.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber at the BBC
item.description: To mark his 75th birthday, Andrew Lloyd Webber takes a nostalgic journey through the BBC archives, looking back on some of his biggest and best-loved songs.

item.title: The MI5 Spy and the IRA: Operation Chiffon
item.description: Journalist Peter Taylor reveals the extraordinary story of how a former undercover MI5 officer put his life and career on the line to encourage the IRA to end its violent campaign and embrace politics

item.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
item.description: In this heartfelt journey of self-discovery, Christine McGuinness uncovers a hidden world of thousands of autistic women who, like her, have been ignored by science and society.

item.title: Brickies
item.description: The brickies are back building houses, earning cash and overcoming obstacles. New face Leah makes a quick impression, while Lucas has his attitude called into question by the boss.

item.title: Dragons' Den
item.description: Facing the Dragons tonight are a young cancer survivor with a stylish pillbox alternative, and two school friends who believe they’ve spotted a gap in the skincare market.

item.title: Weight Loss Surgery: Getting Thin Abroad
item.description: BBC Three investigates if it’s safe to travel abroad for life-changing weight loss surgery.

item.title: The Repair Shop
item.description: The team restores a Ukrainian painting which survived a WWII labour camp and a 1960s bookings calendar from Liverpool's Cavern Club, which records an early Beatles performance.

item.title: Happy Valley
item.description: When Catherine discovers the remains of a murder victim, it bizarrely leads her straight back to Tommy Lee Royce.

item.title: Guilt
item.description: Contemporary thriller with a strong vein of black humour. Guilt follows two very different Scottish brothers who while driving home one night kill an old man.

item.title: Parole
item.description: 54-year-old Colin committed a brutal murder 25 years ago. With his victim's widow waiting anxiously for the decision, will the parole board decide that he is safe to be let back into the community?

item.title: Luther
item.description: Crime drama series. Luther, back from suspension, must solve a seemingly perfect double murder and work out how, and by whom, it was committed.

item.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
item.description: In 1939, four-year-old Joyce Cox vanished whilst on her way home. Her killer has never been caught. Can the Dark Land team help her family to solve an eight-decades-old mystery?

item.title: Life and Death in the Warehouse
item.description: The story of trainee warehouse manager Megan, who, desperate to keep her new job, bullies her pregnant friend Alys, to get her pick rate up, putting Alys and her baby at risk.

item.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing Up to China
item.description: Jane Corbin investigates how the Taiwan's government and young people are fighting what they say is Chinese disinformation, cyber attacks and dirty tricks.

item.title: Waterloo Road
item.description: When the students begin fighting back and a full-on rebellion threatens to disrupt any sense of order, headteacher Kim Campbell is forced into drastic action.

item.title: Paris Police 1905
item.description: Christmas Eve, 1904. Inspector Antoine Jouin attempts to identify a corpse found in the Bois de Boulogne as orders are given to round up the city's prostitutes.

item.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
item.description: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray are at the Stranraer Oyster Festival, marking the start of the native oyster season. Healthy ready meals and frozen pea secrets are also on the menu.

item.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
item.description: At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant; in neurosurgery, Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain surgery.

item.title: We Need to Talk about Cosby
item.description: An exploration of Bill Cosby’s descent from 'America’s dad' to purported sexual predator. In the 1960s, Cosby was collecting accolades for his comedy while allegedly beginning to exploit his power.

item.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
item.description: Charlotte introduces us to her hometown of Sunderland. Life is busy with family, her partner Jake and running her new business. How will she respond to this life-changing news?

item.title: Don't Look Now
item.description: Acclaimed film mystery. Grieving the loss of their young daughter in a tragic accident, Laura and John Baxter visit Venice, where John is helping to restore a dilapidated church.

item.title: The Peanut Butter Falcon
item.description: A young man with Down's syndrome runs away from his care home to pursue his dream of becoming a wrestler.

item.title: Game Night
item.description: Max and Annie's weekly game night gets out of hand when Max's overachieving brother Brooks tries to take it to another level. His murder mystery game turns out to be all too real.

item.title: Eaten by Lions
item.description: When half-brothers Omar and Pete lose the grandmother they grew up with, they decide to set off for Blackpool together, in search of Omar's estranged father.

item.title: Shakespeare in Love
item.description: William Shakespeare is out of ideas. That is, until Viola de Lesseps, the stage-struck daughter of a wealthy merchant, attends auditions disguised as Thomas Kent.

item.title: One Zoo Three
item.description: The OZT brothers meet the wildlife heroes working to save Britain's woodland animals. Cam rescues red squirrels, Tyler meets bears and wolves, and Aaron reveals the wonders of the tawny owl.

item.title: Victoria and Abdul
item.description: Period drama. Adbul Karim is whisked from his clerk's job at an Accra prison to present a ceremonial coin to Queen Victoria for her golden jubilee, along with his more reluctant companion Mohammed.

item.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
item.description: Biographical comedy drama set in 1940s New York. A wealthy socialite opens herself up to ridicule when she pursues a career in opera, despite being unable to sing.

item.title: An Irish Goodbye
item.description: Bafta and Oscar-winning black comedy following the reunion of estranged brothers Turlough and Lorcan following the untimely death of their mother.

item.title: Doctor Who
item.description: On Halloween, all across the universe, terrifying forces are stirring. The life of Dan Lewis is about to change forever. Why is the Doctor chasing Karvanista? What is the Flux?

item.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
item.description: Comedy series about a loudmouthed Irish matriarch. Agnes's son has fallen out with his girlfriend. Will Agnes's attempts to mend the rift makes things better or worse?

item.title: Bluey
item.description: While Mum and Dad struggle to build new flat-pack furniture, Bluey and Bingo transform the empty boxes into their own new world.

item.title: Hey Duggee
item.description: Norrie and her friends reflect on their first meeting and how Norrie enjoyed the peace of the Clubhouse away from her 72 siblings.

item.title: Octonauts
item.description: The Octonauts must find a way to help an injured tuna catch up with her school, before they speed out of reach.

item.title: The Beaker Girls
item.description: Jess leads a protest against an environmentally unfriendly café against her mum’s advice and Jordan and Asha set out to change Mrs Cook’s unrepresentative musical.
